channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7869] Provide way to not start LogSyncer thread
item.description:
In our usecase we want all the Mutations on all the tables to be immediately written and synced to WAL. We dont want the LogSyncer thread to be running in such a case.

In minbatch operation we write entries to WAL and we use postWALWrite and write some more WAL entries(Only write no sync). We want all these written data to be synced as one unit (at the sync step in doMiniBatchOperation) But if the LogSyncer thread is running in the system it can come and do the sync at any point in time which we dont want in our case.
item.summary: Provide way to not start LogSyncer thread

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Suggestion from Lars Hofhansl in HBASE-7801

Looking at the code, we could just not start the LogSyncer if hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval is set to 0. I'd fear there might be other side effects, but it could just work. But that's for a different jira anyway.

I think it should be safe to add. We will clearly mention that when this is set as 0 the LogSyncer thread wont be started at all and defered syncing of Mutation should not be used.

Presence of LogSyncer thread should be optional in the system

The problem with this approach is that in that case you cannot place any region of a table declared with deferred flush on this region server. I still think disabling the logSyncer altogether is a risky proposition.

One could also introduce a "deferred sync lock" (or maybe use one of the existing lock) to prevent the background thread from syncing when that would interfere with the logic.
Generally edits that need to be applied atomically should be added to same WALEdit.

Yes Lars Hofhansl. Only when all the tables dont need a defered sync, then only this can be used. Otherwise this cannot be used.

Generally edits that need to be applied atomically should be added to same WALEdit.

Yes that is the correct way. I filed HBASE-7855 for this and will work on that.
What I felt was if the use case is like one dont want the defered sync at all in his cluster still the LogSyncer thread is not optional. Is that good? Pls correct me if I am wrong. Thanks Lars for taking a look.

I suppose there is no harm in disabling the syncer if it's done through a config option.
We can either use hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval=0 or maybe hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval=MAX_INT.

hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval=0 in other words mean sync it as and when. So no need for the existence of the deferred syncer thread at all then. +1 for this Lars. I will make a patch and give. We can clearly document this. The default value for this config is 1 sec.

So the fix will be something like check if the configured value is hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval is 0 and if so do not start the thread right?
Just asking, why not introduce a parameter hbase.regionserver.uselogsyncer=false. If this is false do not start the log syncer thread.
And also we should avoid the wait statement that happens on closeLogSyncer while close() is happening if LogSyncer is not started.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan New config item may not be needed. When hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval is set as 0, means you need an immediate sync for all the operations. The thread is starting for the deferred sync. So in this case thread wont be useful at all and so dont start it at all. Yes at the close() time no need to go for the thread close part and join.
Run HLog related tests locally and passed. Let QA run. I will see any more changes needed in other parts as we dont have syncer thread

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12569876/HBASE-7869_Trunk.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4458//console

This message is automatically generated.
Lars Hofhansl, ramkrishna.s.vasudevan Can you guys review this once?
I mean review once please

I saw the patch that time itself. Forgot to comment on it.
We will just add a release not right about the new behaviour when the property is 0? That should be fine.
+1 from me.

What if we had a table with deferred flush enabled? I think in syncOrDefer we should one of the following:

  1. Ignore the deferred setting and flush synchronously
  2. Log a warning (or an error)?
  3. throw a DoNotRetryException back to the client.
But my mutation will have WritetoLog set to false. And sync will be called manually by the CP hook. May be am missing something here.

That maybe true for your usecase, but generally if you disable the syncer and have a table setup with deferred log flush, all regions for that table located on this region server would potentially never flush their logs (possibly for days or weeks).

When Mutation is having WriteToWAL as false, deferred sync is out of question any way.
To address Lars comment

  • IMO we should do 1#. Mutation wanted it to be written to WAL. By default the log syncer thread will be started and here user some how changed the interval to 0. An interval 0 means need an immediate sync.
  • During the startup if the value is set as 0 and we don't start a syncer thread, we will log an INFO saying clearly that deferred syncing wont work with this RS and all such will be synced immediately.

What do you guys say?

That works.

In light of this, do you still want to do this? Maybe for your use case it is better to temporarily block the syncer thread from syncing in the background?
I'm not opposed, just asking.

I will wait for HBASE-7801 to go in as that is introducing the per Mutation deferred log sync capability.

In light of this, do you still want to do this? Maybe for your use case it is better to temporarily block the syncer thread from syncing in the background?

IMHO for our use case doing this blocking and then unblocking is extra overhead. I think there will be many use cases which will need immediate sync.

Let's commit this (a version that does the sync immediately if the syncer is not started and logs an INFO at RS statup when the sync interval is 0).

Do you have time to make a patch Anoop Sam John?
Sure Lars Hofhansl. I had done it half way. Will upload the latest patch tonight(IST)
Lars Hofhansl Patch attached. Pls review

Patch looks good.

Thanks for the review Ted Yu, Lars Hofhansl.
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan Any comments from your side?

+1 on patch.
May be a small release not is needed.
Sure Ram.. I need to add it after the commit right?
What's a "small release"?
I meant a small release note
Oho.. I read Ram's comment as release note only...

Committed to 0.94, 0.95, and 0.98.
Thanks for the patch Anoop
